website_summaries.verdict: According to a number of users, they were satisfied with the comfort and support provided by the Brooks Ariel 18. Several consumers also attested the noticeable improvements the shoe presented versus its predecessor. When it comes to motion-control road running shoes, the Brooks Ariel 18 is a worthy choice for many overpronators.
pros: The Ariel 18 seemed to be sturdier compared to the previous version, a user observed
Many wearers were happy that the Ariel 18 did not require a break-in period
A lot of customers expressed their approval of the shoe’s many width options
The shoe was very comfortable to wear even for extended periods of time, according to some buyers
The broader toe box was an excellent improvement in the shoe, said a reviewer
The Brooks Ariel 18 was effective in reducing overpronation, as agreed upon by numerous consumers
cons: A few wearers thought the Ariel 18 had small sizing
Some users described the shoe as heavy
The Brooks Ariel 18 was an expensive shoe, a buyer remarked

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Ripped Within 10 Days
customer_reviews.text: This is 5th pair of women's Ariel I have owned and they are a great shoe. However this newly designed pair started ripping at the edge within 10 days of moderate use (2-4 hours of wear) and has continued to do so. Although they were a Prime item, they are no longer eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: BROOKS SHOED
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Brooks. They were recommended by me for doctor. They are the only shoes I wear most of the time. These are even more comfortable and seem to have a smaller tongue... That makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: slightly softer foot bed than the Ariel 16
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cuz I loved the Brooks Ariel 16 and figured these are the newer version. I would say the foot bed in this shoe is a little softer than the 16's. Which is okay but I prefer a very firm foot bed because of planters fasciatis. The Arial 16 was the perfect shoe for my foot but they no longer make it. I work retail and spend 8 hours on my feet on concrete and never had problem with the 16. So far I've had slightly achy feet after a week of wear.
customer_reviews.author: patapu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent amount of cushion
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy walking in these shoes. It has plenty of cushion throughout the shoe. The color is nice but the shoe laces could be a little longer. I actually thread my laces to the last hole because I have skinny ankles and it prevents heel slippage when I walk. I've never worn this type of shoes before so it's taken me at least a week to adjust to the extra support it offers for overpronation. Overall a nice pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: insole is cushioned, not the shoe
customer_reviews.text: Beware with this shoe that a good part of the cushion is in the removable insole. If you intend like I did to remove them and use an orthotic, you lose a lot of cush. And the insole is too thick to keep under an orthotic. Great for pronation. Not a soft ride at all.
customer_reviews.author: TCNan

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinarily comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: The bad: I wear a 10 W in everything else, but I had to get a 10.5 in this shoe. The good: I love these. Once I had the right size, I put them on and never took them off again. They are fairly light, have an amazingly generous toe box but stay on my heels (the heels are well padded and "give" as needed"), seem to handle perspiration well and do not feel hot to wear, and have great support. I have one flat foot and one foot with a normal arch, and both feet are happy with this shoe. My feet are probably more comfortable than they've ever been before.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Shopper

customer_reviews.title: So far I really like these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice looking shoes and even though I have only had them for a few days, so far they are very comfortable. I do have custom orthotics and had to remove the foot bed that came in the shoes to fit my orthotics in. I like the stretchy laces that came in the shoes as they are more comfortable on the top of my foot, probably because my foot sits higher in the shoe because of my thicker orthotics. All in all, I really like these shoes and they do give me good support and I will most likely get another pair in the lighter grey color.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Great for my overpronation and flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this model before and am always happy with the support they provide. It's not so hard to get decent arch support in "regular" shoes, but the roll-bar feature that keeps me from overpronating is much harder to come by. Will definitely buy them again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenceco

customer_reviews.title: Brooks has gone back to a nice wide toe box.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks Ariel for 10 years and am very happy with this Ariel 18. They now fit like they used to before Brooks changed the design. The prior Brooks Ariel design was changed and the toe box was too small and the mesh wore out very quickly and you had a hole in it. they have gone back to the prior design and strengthened the mesh so I expect this new pair will wear better.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great Support for Overpronaters!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully supportive, stable shoe! The design really keeps my ankles straight when I walk and that is a feat with my disability! If you overpronate, I highly recommend the Ariel 18. The toe box has plenty of room and the sizing is generous. I wore an 11 B in my previous Asics GT 2150 (years ago), but a 10.5 in the Brooks Ariel 18 fits nicely. I could possibly even wear a 10. It is comfortable to wear straight out of the box - no break-in time needed. My only complaint are the limited color options!! I purchased the gray and pink to have a lighter color for summer, but would have loved a blue option.
customer_reviews.author: BeyondBlessed

customer_reviews.title: The mesh shoe tops tear way too easily
customer_reviews.text: For the price they ask for these shoes the cheap mesh tops wear out way too fast. All you need to do is drag your toe a bit or catch the mesh on something and a hole rips in them. Also the stitching along the mesh and support comes unsewn. The older Brooks Ariels lasted much longer and were much better for me. However, I do love the increased cushioning of the Ariel 16. The 18's don't have as much cushioning or support. Both 16 and 18 have cheap mesh tops that tear easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ollimbo

customer_reviews.title: Love Brooks Ariel
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these shoes for more than a decade. They were originally recommended to help with plantar fascitis, but they have solved other foot issues as well. If you need a stiff, well cushioned shoe, they are wonderful. only downside is that colors are limited. Some years it has been difficult to find something in a subtle color scheme.
customer_reviews.author: D Kearney

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are life (foot) savers.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my mother (70yr old health nut who is in the gym 6 days a week) who has the health of a 20yr old but feet that require a lot of support. She swears by these after buying her first pair and had me hunt her down more pairs. Any arch related pain is now gone and she is free to embarrass my brother’s and I with her perfect health.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Liebman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Brooks shoes since I got plantar fasciitis. Brooks Ariel is the most comfortable and cushioned shoe. I've also worn Brooks Addiction, but still find Ariel to feel the best for my feet. I've tried on other brands and styles but always ended up purchasing Brooks Ariel because it felt more cushioned and just fit so well.
customer_reviews.author: Helen of Troy

customer_reviews.title: Used item with cat hair
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is great. The seller is terrible. It’s a used item that has tied laces, bends in from someone wearing it & cat hair. I’m severely allergic to cats!! I will not keep these and will buy from somewhere that doesn’t send out used shoes for $160. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: T. H.

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable Running shoe I’ve ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Ariel16, but the 18 is even better. So much cushier, but still lots of support for pronaters. I ordered 1/2 size larger, which I always do with running shoes. They fit my feet like a glove, with enough stretch in the top of the shoe to not put pressure on my bunion.
customer_reviews.author: Chargedup

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Brooks
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with these shoes. For many years alll I could wear were Nike brand. And one day Nike just didn't work for me anymore....I don't know what changed....but my feet hurt...my legs hurt and my lower back. After numerous suggestions to try Brooks...I'm very happy that I did. My pain is gone. When my husband saw the success I was having .....we got him a pair as well. He also was relieved from pain.
customer_reviews.author: Bordertown

customer_reviews.title: Ariels are the best shoe for support and long term comfort while walking.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is a running shoe I have always used Ariels for walking. Have probably had fifteen pairs and this one is the best designed of them all. Works well and even though I am more a supinator than a pronator, the motion control is excellent. Have tried a couple of other brands and Brooks styles in between all my Ariels, but always return to the Ariels. They fully wrap the foot yet are comfortable and supportive. If you have any foot issues, knee, or back issues, this shoe can be a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: desertgirl

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to help with pains in my feet after recently breaking my fifth metatarsal in my right foot. I really expected the shoes to have more cushioning since it's so emphasized in the descriptions but it was not a very comfortable shoe. I also wasnt expected them to be as large and clunky as they are in person. I took them to UPS to return shortly after they arrived because $160 is too much to pay for a shoe you don't love. For those who have previous experience with the Brooks Ariel shoes, you may love them. They just weren't what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: great shoe for really flat feet with wider toe box
customer_reviews.text: I love this particular Brooks Ariel. It's wider in the toe box than the last model so whereas I would previously purchase a 9D to give more toe box room I purchased a 9B in this particular model. If you have very flat feet and need a really good tennis shoe for motion control and stability this is the one my podiatrist says is best and I agree at least for me. I do wear custom orthotics and also sometimes an AFO on one or both feet. These accommodate the AFO without having to go up a half size in length.
customer_reviews.author: Maria A

customer_reviews.title: Classic Ariel Fit!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned because people said the didn’t fit like the old Ariel’s from years past. I have had more than probably 15 pairs of Brooks Ariel due to previous injury and surgery. These are great and the look fantastic! If only the Ariel’s came with more color choices.......
customer_reviews.author: tanya evans

customer_reviews.title: This is my third pair of Brooks Ariels
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of Brooks Ariels at the suggestion of a podiatrist to hopefully solve my problems with plantar fasciitis. They did the trick and no further treatment was necessary. Now I buy a pair every time the current pair starts to get too worn. Great shoes and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Wolff

customer_reviews.title: A great, well cushioned, walking/running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn several versions of Brooks Ariel over the years, and I keep replacing them with newer versions, as needed. This is a great shoe. My only problem with them is that I tend to wear through the top of the toe box around the big toe, because they don't reinforce that area well. This happened with my two previous Ariel pairs of shoes, and I expect that it will happen with these new ones too, eventually. So...I wish Brooks would reinforce the top front end of their toe box better. Nevertheless, that flaw does not prevent me from coming back to this shoe over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: The fit is different than the 16.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks Ariel’s for several years. For me, this year’s version is too wide for the overall show. My foot slips around and for me, that is a hazard. The level of support of the Ariel style is by far better than any other shoe I’ve tried. I am very much a senior who obviously is not a runner but this shoe was recommended by my podiatrist.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are tattered 2 months in to wearing them!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in these shoes, walking only for a little over 2 months and they are already ripping on the sides of the ankle area. I have worn these Brooks Ariel shoes for years and I am so disappointed in the quality. I have had them such a short time and I don't do hard workouts in these and they already are looking tattered. It's a bummer considering they are over $100. Even though they are comfortable, they are not going to last much longer without looking awful. I am going to have to look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: m range

customer_reviews.title: Totally grateful to have found Ariel 18
customer_reviews.text: I spend from 60-80 hours a week in these shoes and they saved my feet and my disposition during a strenuous period at work. I bought them online (yikes!) based on the description (expanded toe box was a biggie) and wore them when they arrived for a full 12-hour day. Just ordered a second pair so I can rotate and eventually replace my veteran pair. The perfect show for me. Thanks to the each and all who contributed to the creation of Ariel 18. Thanks for the "thistle" option. My fav!
customer_reviews.author: KCMO Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Goldilocks' perfect shoe is just right!
customer_reviews.text: After many tries I have found the perfect shoe. This is by far the most stable, supportive, and comfortable shoe I own. Honestly, it is just right in every way. I love the Ariel series and for me, this is the best one yet. The color combo is lovely. The soft periwinkle laces are a great addition. Highly recommend for a wide foot that needs support.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn D

customer_reviews.title: No foot pain
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my shoes. Walked all day in them the first day and no foot pain. 6/24. I received the shoes on 4/28. I wear them every morning to walk the dog, about 2 miles. The binding on top/around the ankle is shredding. On both shoes in the same place. I would think they would last longer than 2 months. Other than that, I really like them, their extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: True to size similar to 16 but not the same
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Ariel 18 shoes I've had three or four pairs of the Ariel 16 and really like them but the price more than doubled in six months so I tried these. The fit was as expected with maybe a bit more toe room, the arch and heel were similar to the 16 as was the outer and sole of the shoe. I usually get about 6 months out of a pair and I've only had these for about two so we will see how they last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell if still quality shoe!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fit just as it was expected. I probably could have gone with the the regular width instead of wide. Hopefully they won't stretch out much. Nice looking shoe. We will see how long they last. I've been buying Brooks for a few years now for support and plantar fasciitis. These aren't made as well as they used to be, but priced the same. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Bjfln

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my sister since it’s really comfortable, 2 months on to wearing this occasionally the fabric around the ankle started breaking and it looks awful. The return window is closed so 160$ gone for nothing. Will never buy brooks again.
customer_reviews.author: khalil hamoudeh

customer_reviews.title: Not Like they used to be...
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in my new Brooks sneakers. I have only worn them for the past few months and The wear on the bottom as well as the sides is worse than past years with this exact sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Brooks tennis shoes for the past 7 years and have never seen such poor quality in any of my past shoes until this pair. This is the 2nd pair of Arials and my old ones that are 2 years old look better than this pair. There are holes around the edges where you put in your foot and the support appears to be gone in the shoe. I paid $160 for these shoes and they are only 3 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah flores

customer_reviews.title: Finally Comfortable While Walking & Jogging
customer_reviews.text: I love my Brooks running shoes! At long last, walking and jogging are finally comfortable. I ordered a half size larger than my usual shoe size, and they fit perfectly. I also visited the Brooks Sports web site and used the Shoe Finder tool to find the right shoe for me. If you decide to go with Brooks, I hope you're as happy as I am.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, these are wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Once you go Brooks you’ll never go back. This is my fourth pair after about 4 years. I’ve had three knee surgeries and putting on my first pair of Brooks made me tear up, they felt so good. I ran in the Gylcerins, wore Cascada for casual, and these are great for both. I mainly walk steep asphalt hills of my neighborhood and these are awesome. Worth the cost, fit great, no awkward break in time, they’re ready to roll straight outta the box.
customer_reviews.author: vtkaty13

customer_reviews.title: lightweightand very comfortable. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the only sorry sore I wear. Gel foam included, lightweightand very comfortable. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: mandm

customer_reviews.title: I had been looking for a pair of brooks that ...
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a pair of brooks that fit me well and these are it...wide and lots of toe room.
customer_reviews.author: georgette

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Bummed and disappointed that Brooks changed the style so much. They feel more like bricks on your feet than the "pillowy" feeling of the past. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Lilia

customer_reviews.title: sooo comfy, especially ROOMY TOEBOX
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome running sneakers, especially if you have to run on the road sometimes. I prefer trails, & these are great on both, but they also feel fine on the road & sidewalks. The toebox is literally perfect, which is impossible to find these days. There is enough room for all 5 toes to lay flat & still have some room, especially for longer runs where your feet may get swollen or you need more room.
customer_reviews.author: Puss Puss

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these shoes. I have plantar fasciitis and these have been the best workout shoes I have ever had. Why do they have to be so expensive??? Worth it though. Wish they had a few more color choices.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The Ariel ‘18 is a nice upgrade from previous versions. The heel pad is a little “bubbly”, but doesn’t feel bad. It is key to wear the right kind of sock. I wear low-cut socks with just enough heel flap to not creep down into the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: KDD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy my running shoes from a local running store but decided to order the same pair from Amazon. These are horrible. My feet hurt and they feel hard, no cushioning. These feel like knock offs and I’m shocked Brooks would feel like this. I’m out $160.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne ankenbauer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are the o ly shoes I buy. I have a severe pronation and my ankles don't align proper and these have helped to correct my ankle position.
customer_reviews.author: ADishman

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: These are way too stiff. I have been wearing Books Ariel's for years and this model caused aches and pains in my hip.
customer_reviews.author: D. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I really like these sneakers. I can easily put my orthodics inside once I take out of the insert. The only draw back is this is the second pair that frays at the collar below the ankle (inside collar). It's frustrating, but I love the comfort of these Brooks (these are my third pair).
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerJR

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoes - the only kind I buy
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for years. They were one of several recommendations from my orthopedic Doctor. The Brooks were the first of his recommendations I tried and I've been using them ever since. They have helped the tendon problems I had so I stick with them.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Bock

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase !
customer_reviews.text: This my first pair of Brooks athletic shoes. The Ebony/Black/Thistle color is totally awesome. The fit is perfect. Delivered in time. Very good purchase. Only reason for return is because a device on one foot does not accommodate the size.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Back to the old Ariel design!! Yay!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these sneakers. Great fit and support. Wish they had better colors but I’ll make do because my feet feel good in them.!
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Super stable. I use arch support inserts because my feet need the extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Everyday comfort shoe with my orthodic
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes, because of the comfort of being able to walk in them everyday. I'm on my feet at work from 8-9 hr shift & my dogs are usually barking! But with the ariels, I was pleased. Ladies if you are in the same boat as me, then I would definitely recommend paying the extra moolah for a fantastic walking shoe!
customer_reviews.author: kimbee

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Have tried this shoe for a month and it the most uncomfortable pair I have purchased. The design is all off. No arch support. My back hurts constantly as well as additional pressure on the knees. No stability in these. Why are women's tennis shoes constantly constructed in the heel area like a man's shoe??? Women heels are more narrow even though the front toe area may widen, the heel remains narrow. Only one shoe company has that down pat, and that is a shame for the designers / manufacturers today!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for my messed up feet. Very supportive which is very important to me. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: confusion over availability
customer_reviews.text: product was good as usual but I ordered a half size larger since 9 1/2 wasn't available at same price. after ibreceived shoes and wire them for a day I received an ad from Amazon of shoes in my size for even less price and faster shipping
customer_reviews.author: Joan o

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These Shoes were comfortable from the very first time I wore them. They fit perfectly. (Note: I have been wearing Brooks Ariels for years and I always buy a half-size larger than most other shoes.) Comfortable, cool, and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy C

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe overall
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, I do notice that the sho strings seem delicate so be gentle or you might rip them, same with the fabric on the toe box. It seems less durable but time will tell. I think overall it’s a great fit but I wish it was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Inga

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for over-pronation!
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter’s 2nd pair of Ariel ‘18. Her feet over pronate & for years she had aches & pains in her ankles, knees & hips. These shoes keep her feet and ankles in line & are the most comfortable she’s ever had. She wears them daily & along with some stretching & exercise they have greatly improved her discomfort and ability to be on her feet for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: JUSTaMOM

customer_reviews.title: Large around heels
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Brooks Adrenaline but thought I'd try something new. These felt too large around my ankles/heels. I felt like I was going to walk out of them. I've been wearing Brooks for years so I know they were the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Last year when they changed the style I was ver upset as this is the only shoe I can wear in comfort. Thank god they changed it back. It does run big 1/2 size big for me.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. I did not want to pay the price for a shoe. Worth everything I paid for in comfort. My foot pain is so much better. I love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kandie

customer_reviews.title: Toe box not wide enough.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return as the toe box isn’t as wide as the old style Ariel’s from 2014. I went to Academy and found Saucony and those feel great. I think Brooks are probably made better and certainly will last longer but I have a wide toe area and narrower heels. Comfort rules all.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Ehrhardt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes that don't look like puked up crayons
customer_reviews.text: Really really like these so far. I only where Brooks shoes and I don't understand how can be so hard to fine in shoe stores. Nike just sucks compared to Brooks
customer_reviews.author: Lacybug

customer_reviews.title: Finally A Shoe That Fits!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fantastic! I am not a runner but a long time walker. I have looked for months for shoes that are comfortable enough to get me back to walking. My feet have a variety of problems including arthritis and bunions and my feet overpronate. I need a shoe with a narrow heel as my feet are not wide. The wide toe bed and cushioning at the ball of the feet are great plus the higher heel of the shoe with its cushioning help support my back. I can also use orthotics if desired. Thanks Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: Helen F. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: The color and style are great but they hurt my feet It seems like the toe box runs small. Why do companies fix what is not broken. I have been buying these for years and they were fine up until now.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel513

customer_reviews.title: 5’1”, size 6, and in my sixties
customer_reviews.text: I have an average arch and so far my favorite Brooks shoes are the Glycerin 17. I worked a 13 hour day, 95% of that time on my feet, at the early vote poll and loved them. With the Ariel 18 I found the arch was too high and my feet rolled to the outside. I live in the country and I’m looking for the perfect shoe that is comfortable for long walks on both pavement, gravel, dirt, hills, and treadmill. I know I’m asking for a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Melvin

customer_reviews.title: So Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, one for the Treadmill and one pair are my new gardening shoes. Love these. Fast shipping and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the MOST comfortable shoes EVER! I have arthritis in one foot and these shoes make all the difference in the world!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Schule

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy heel support
customer_reviews.text: I have to have a good supportive shoe that is not too cushy. So many have memory foam that is too squishy for those of us that need stability. I find this to be the perfect amount of support and the fit is true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Holden

customer_reviews.title: Great support shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love ❤️ these shoes! I have orthotics and these are perfect! Very dissatisfied with the 20 version!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks! I have wide feet and these were a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cathi

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have extreme over pronation and need correction. These work great and are very comfortable!!
customer_reviews.author: KS family

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I was getting a lot of blisters while Power Walking. I'm 74 years old and need a wider toe because of arthritis. I've been wearing these for a week and love them!!! I have no pain and I walk 3 miles every day. I'm going to buy a second pair soon!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G

customer_reviews.title: Very good support
customer_reviews.text: I've worn several pairs of Brooks athletic shoes and I like the support they give my feet. I just returned from Europe and walked in them everyday for 2 months and my feet didn't hurt. I have a lot of foot issues and they support my feet really good.
customer_reviews.author: robert d jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Have flat feet!! These are the only shoes I can wear. Also fit with orthotics
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Cushion & support
customer_reviews.text: It’s like walking on a cloud. I plan to purchase additional Ariel 18’s.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe. Perfect support. Perfect service. Construction is perfect as well. 1 million stars for service! Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: TrishBVA

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet
customer_reviews.text: The brooks shoe is perfect for my feet. There is no need to break in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ola

customer_reviews.title: Best Sneakers Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best sneakers I have ever owned! Also, most expensive but they feel like they were custom made for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing this line of shoes for about 10 years. Awesome for hip and back issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Generously sized
customer_reviews.text: I generally wear an XXWide, but the Wide works. There is plenty of room for custom orthotics. They are my best walking shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe for walking, especially after a leg or foot surgery. Firm and places the right pressures all along the entire foot.
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I better buy more of these before the company redesigns them again.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for 5k walks. I can no longer run as my knees' warranty has expired. I hope these last longer than my last pair.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Walking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are an excellent fit and work amazingly as I walk several miles a day in them. My son bought me another pair for my birthday as I liked them so much. Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cheerful Cherub

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down for Overpronators
customer_reviews.text: I’m flat footed and I was hoping these shoes would Be more comfortable to run in but these shoes seem heavier, bulkier and not very comfortable. I usually wear ASICS but heard great reviews about these shoes. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this model for years. They work well with my orthotics and I wouldn't want to run with any other sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & supportive athletic shoes
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable walking shoes I’ve ever owned. Loved them so much I bought a 2nd pair.
customer_reviews.author: T. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Fit true to size for brooks... I always go up a size
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing brook ariel shoes for years.. I like the 18 a lot... first got them for a trip to Disney... walked day and night for 3 days... feet felt great... I walk about 25 miles a week ... waiting for winter to be over before I use these for that still using my old brooks
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have significant over pronation and these shoes are great for walking or running. Love the pink gray design that’s super cute. I always order a half size up for any running shoe. These fit perfectly and even better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Happy2beme2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable from the first time wearing it. I have problems with my feet and these fit perfectly. They are priced too high .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Felt great out of the box. No breaking in necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Commander

customer_reviews.title: Brooks shoes moved its warehouse and has stoped production of certain shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Toe is lose. I can’t get a good fit. Need a Ariel 16 but refuse to pay double the price through a third party vendor on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing !
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear the Ariel 16, as it was not available I ordered the 16 expecting a similar if not better fit and comfort. The Medium wide is very wide for my foot. The shoe has little cushioning and very little support. I will not order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie

customer_reviews.title: They fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very hard to fit foot and the Ariel is the only sneaker that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and support.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks Ariel for years. They are so comfy! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Wohlers

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great support for my ankles. They correct my severe overpronation & fit very well. More attractive than other Brooks I've had.
customer_reviews.author: PMc

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Liked that there is extra plastic on the big toe area. This was a problem with my last shoes...My toe poked through and tore the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MARCELEH

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Even though they are a little bigger than expected, I love these shoes! Compared to my previous two pairs of Brooks Ariel shoes, the heal is a bit loose but they were comfortable from the start and style and quality couldn’t be better.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: check the content of the box before shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I give one star b/c, I received a different color and size and I have to return it. Aside from that like brooks shoes.
customer_reviews.author: faith

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this brand for a long time and I really like them, love the color and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Latingirl

customer_reviews.title: They are not as comfortable as my previous brooks
customer_reviews.text: Padding at the ball of the foot and toe area is very thin and it feels like you are walking on concrete inside the shoe. My other brooks for pronation were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: mellen

customer_reviews.title: BROOKS SHOES
customer_reviews.text: BROOKS SHOES ARE THE MOST COMFORTABLE SHOES I HAVE FOUND
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Brooks Women's Ariel '18 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Designed to endure almost everything, our shoe that offers the greatest support ensures maximum stability, while also ensuring an incredibly soft feeling underfoot. This is the leading product in its category, it represents the maximum, both in appearance and in the fit, thanks to a new upper created without seams and to the midsole in Super DNA.\n\n The absorbing midsole in BioMoGo DNA, made with and biodegradable materials, adapts dynamically to every stride while the Progressive Diagonal Rollbar (PDRB) extends the body back into its natural movement pattern with even more control . The segmented Crash Pad, characterized by special padding located between the midsole and the outer sole, offers soft heel-toe transitions while the Omega Flex Grooves improve its flexibility. The perforated mesh upper guarantees breathability and optimizes moisture management, keeping feet fresh and dry.
feature_bullets: Surface: Road. Differential: 12 mm. Built for the sever overpronator who requires motion control and high-level cushioning. Engineered mesh and synthetic upper for a soft, flexible feel and excellent breathability. Updated foot last provides added a roomier forefoot area for a more comfortable fit. External, structured saddle allows for adjustable support. Lace-up closure. External heel counter helps stabilize the foot. Plush tongue and collar. Breathable mesh lining wicks away moisture a
The lightweight, responsive, and supportive style of the Brooks® Ariel '18 running shoe will have you ready to run your best every day!
